American.title: Classic Cheeseburger
American.instructions: Form ground beef into 4 patties and season with salt and pepper. Cook on grill or skillet for 4-5 minutes per side. Toast buns with butter. Assemble burgers with cheese, onion, tomato, lettuce, and condiments. Serve hot with fries.

American.title: BBQ Ribs
American.instructions: Mix dry spices and rub on ribs. Let marinate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 275°F. Wrap ribs in foil and bake for 2.5 hours. Remove foil, brush with BBQ sauce, and bake for 30 minutes. Serve with coleslaw and cornbread.

American.title: Mac and Cheese
American.instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Make roux with butter and flour. Add milk gradually, stirring constantly. Add cheeses and seasonings. Mix with cooked pasta. Top with breadcrumbs and melted butter. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until golden.

American.title: Fried Chicken
American.instructions: Mix flour with spices. Beat eggs with buttermilk. Dredge chicken in flour, dip in egg mixture, then flour again. Heat oil to 350°F and fry chicken for 12-15 minutes until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

American.title: Buffalo Wings
American.instructions: Bake wings at 400°F for 45 minutes until crispy. Mix hot sauce, butter, vinegar, and spices. Toss wings in sauce. Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery/carrot sticks.

American.title: Clam Chowder
American.instructions: Cook bacon until crispy. Add onion and celery, cook until soft. Add potatoes and clam juice. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Make roux with butter and flour. Add milk and cream gradually. Add clams and seasonings. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

American.title: Meatloaf
American.instructions: Mix all ingredients except glaze. Form into loaf shape. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Mix brown sugar and ketchup for glaze. Brush over meatloaf and bake for 15 minutes more. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

American.title: Apple Pie
American.instructions: Mix apples with sugar, flour, and spices. Line pie pan with one crust. Add apple mixture and dot with butter. Cover with second crust and seal edges. Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 35 minutes.

American.title: Pancakes
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat eggs with milk, butter, and vanilla. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Cook on griddle with butter until bubbles form. Flip and cook until golden. Serve with maple syrup and butter.

American.title: Chicken and Waffles
American.instructions: Marinate chicken in buttermilk for 2 hours. Mix flour with spices. Dredge chicken and fry until golden. For waffles, mix dry ingredients. Beat eggs with milk and butter. Combine and cook in waffle iron. Serve chicken over waffles with maple syrup.

American.title: Caesar Salad
American.instructions: Wash and chop lettuce. Mix all dressing ingredients. Toss lettuce with dressing. Add croutons and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

American.title: Chili Con Carne
ingredients: Shredded cheese and sour cream for serving
American.instructions: Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, beans, and seasonings. Add broth and simmer for 1 hour. Serve with cheese and sour cream.

American.title: Pot Roast
American.instructions: Season roast with salt and pepper. Brown in oil on all sides. Add vegetables, broth, wine, and Worcestershire sauce. Cover and cook at 325°F for 3 hours until tender. Serve with pan juices.

American.title: Cobb Salad
American.instructions: Arrange lettuce on platter. Arrange chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and blue cheese in rows. Drizzle with vinaigrette and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

American.title: Key Lime Pie
American.instructions: Mix crumbs with sugar and butter. Press into pie pan and bake at 350°F for 10 minutes. Beat egg yolks with condensed milk, lime juice, and zest. Pour into crust and bake for 15 minutes. Cool and chill. Whip cream with powdered sugar and top pie. Garnish with lime slices.

American.title: Cornbread
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat egg with milk, butter, and honey. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9-inch pan. Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve warm with butter.

American.title: Pulled Pork
American.instructions: Season pork with spices. Place in slow cooker with onion and garlic. Mix BBQ sauce, brown sugar, and vinegar. Pour over pork. Cook on low for 8 hours. Shred pork and mix with sauce. Serve on buns.

American.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
American.instructions: Mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Cream butter with sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Drop onto baking sheets. Bake at 375°F for 9-11 minutes until golden.

American.title: New York Cheesecake
American.instructions: Mix crumbs with sugar and butter. Press into springform pan. Beat cream cheese with sugar. Add sour cream and vanilla. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add flour. Pour into crust. Bake at 325°F for 1 hour. Cool and chill overnight. Garnish with berries.

American.title: Crab Cakes
American.instructions: Mix crabmeat with breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, egg, mustard, Worcestershire, lemon juice, and seasonings. Form into patties. Chill for 30 minutes. Cook in butter for 4-5 minutes per side until golden. Serve with lemon wedges.
